name: INSULIN_INSTRUCTIONS
description: This table contains dosing instructions for insulin injections and insulin pump settings.

columns.name: DISCRETE_PAT_INSTR_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the instructions name record.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The date of this contact in calendar format.

columns.name: DOSE_TM
columns.description: Time period for specific time-based instructions

columns.name: INSTRUCTIONS_NAME
columns.description: The mealtime name for the insulin injections instructions.

columns.name: BASAL_RATE
columns.description: Basal rate for this time period

columns.name: LOW_GLUCOSE_TARGET
columns.description: Low glucose target for time period

columns.name: HIGH_GLUCOSE_TARGET
columns.description: The high blood glucose target. When tested above this level, the patient may need to take insulin to adjust.

columns.name: INSULIN_CORRECTION_FACTOR
columns.description: Insulin correction factor; the amount one unit of insulin will reduce the blood glucose level.

columns.name: FIXED_DOSE
columns.description: The fixed dose of insulin to take at this time.

columns.name: FIXED_MEALTIME_DOSE
columns.description: The fixed dose of insulin to take with this meal.

columns.name: UNITS_PER_CARB_SERV
columns.description: The number of units of insulin to take for each carb serving (~15g, 8-21g) eaten during this meal.
